search_results.snippet:
Did you know that the delectable herb tarragon is of the artemisia genus? 
Wormwood, Artemisia Absinthium has been used for centuries as a moth 
repellant, ... Wormwood leaves contain absinthin a substance which can be toxic 
to other plants. ... In some parts of Europe, wormwood is called 'Girdle of St. John' 
and is...
search_results.title: Wormwood - Most Holy Faith

question: The "Girdle of St. John" in Europe, this herb contains a toxic substance used to make absinthe
